bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: List of articles by Henry Rose Carter, by [Laura Armistead Carter], [December, 1931]

div1.p: A bibliography composed by Laura Carter lists H.R. Carter's yellow fever articles.

div1.head: List of articles by Henry Rose Carter, by [Laura Armistead Carter], [December, 1931]
div1.p:
Some of the principal of these articles are:
1. Note on the Interval between Infecting and
Secondary Cases of Yellow Fever from the Records of the
Yellow Fever at Orwood and Taylor, Miss., in 1898. (New Orleans Med. & Surg.
Journal, May, 1900)
2. Period of Incubation of Yellow Fever in Man.
(Planned with (1) and (3) and written about the same
time-- the triology forming a complete work). Pub. in
Medical Record, Feb. or March, 1901. Original Manu-
scripts deposited in Army Medical Museum as permanent
loan.
3. A note on the Spread of Yellow Fever in Houses.
Extrinsic Incubation. Medical Record, June 15, 1901.
4. Some Characteristics of Stegomyia Fasciata
Which Affect Its Conveyance of Yellow Fever. Medical
Record, May 14, 1904.
5. Notes on the Sanitation of Yellow Fever and
Malaria from Isthmian Experience. (Pan American Scien-
tific Congress, Santiago de Chile, 1908. Med. Record,
July 10/09).
6. Immunity to Yellow Fever. (Pan American
Scientific Congress 1915. Pub. Annals of Trop. Med.
& Parasitology, Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine,
April 1916).
7. Spontaneous Disappearance of Yellow Fever
by Failure of the Human Host. (Read before the Society
of Tropical Medicine & Hygiene (London) June 1917.
8. Mechanism of the Spontaneous Elimination of
Yellow Fever from Endemic Centers. Journal of Tropical
Medicine & Parasitology: March 1920. Liverpool School
of Tropical Medicine.
